speaker: REGAN
text_entry: SCENE VI. Fields near Dover.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, and EDGAR dressed like a peasant

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: When shall we come to the top of that same hill?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: You do climb up it now: look, how we labour.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methinks the ground is even.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Horrible steep.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hark, do you hear the sea?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No, truly.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Why, then, your other senses grow imperfect

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: By your eyes' anguish.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So may it be, indeed:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methinks thy voice is alter'd; and thou speak'st

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In better phrase and matter than thou didst.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: You're much deceived: in nothing am I changed

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But in my garments.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methinks you're better spoken.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Come on, sir; here's the place: stand still. How fearful

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And dizzy 'tis, to cast one's eyes so low!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The crows and choughs that wing the midway air

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Show scarce so gross as beetles: half way down

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hangs one that gathers samphire, dreadful trade!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Methinks he seems no bigger than his head:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The fishermen, that walk upon the beach,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Appear like mice; and yond tall anchoring bark,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Diminish'd to her cock; her cock, a buoy

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Almost too small for sight: the murmuring surge,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That on the unnumber'd idle pebbles chafes,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Cannot be heard so high. I'll look no more;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Lest my brain turn, and the deficient sight

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Topple down headlong.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Set me where you stand.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Give me your hand: you are now within a foot

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of the extreme verge: for all beneath the moon

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Would I not leap upright.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let go my hand.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here, friend, 's another purse; in it a jewel

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well worth a poor man's taking: fairies and gods

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Prosper it with thee! Go thou farther off;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Bid me farewell, and let me hear thee going.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Now fare you well, good sir.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With all my heart.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Why I do trifle thus with his despair

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Is done to cure it.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Kneeling]  O you mighty gods!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This world I do renounce, and, in your sights,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shake patiently my great affliction off:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If I could bear it longer, and not fall

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To quarrel with your great opposeless wills,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My snuff and loathed part of nature should

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Burn itself out. If Edgar live, O, bless him!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, fellow, fare thee well.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He falls forward

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Gone, sir: farewell.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And yet I know not how conceit may rob

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The treasury of life, when life itself

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Yields to the theft: had he been where he thought,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: By this, had thought been past. Alive or dead?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ho, you sir! friend! Hear you, sir! speak!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thus might he pass indeed: yet he revives.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What are you, sir?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Away, and let me die.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hadst thou been aught but gossamer, feathers, air,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: So many fathom down precipitating,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thou'dst shiver'd like an egg: but thou dost breathe;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hast heavy substance; bleed'st not; speak'st; art sound.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ten masts at each make not the altitude

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Which thou hast perpendicularly fell:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy life's a miracle. Speak yet again.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But have I fall'n, or no?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: From the dread summit of this chalky bourn.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Look up a-height; the shrill-gorged lark so far

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Cannot be seen or heard: do but look up.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, I have no eyes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is wretchedness deprived that benefit,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To end itself by death? 'Twas yet some comfort,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: When misery could beguile the tyrant's rage,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And frustrate his proud will.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Give me your arm:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Up: so. How is 't? Feel you your legs? You stand.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Too well, too well.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: This is above all strangeness.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Upon the crown o' the cliff, what thing was that

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Which parted from you?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A poor unfortunate beggar.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: As I stood here below, methought his eyes

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Were two full moons; he had a thousand noses,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Horns whelk'd and waved like the enridged sea:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: It was some fiend; therefore, thou happy father,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Think that the clearest gods, who make them honours

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of men's impossibilities, have preserved thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I do remember now: henceforth I'll bear

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Affliction till it do cry out itself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: 'Enough, enough,' and die. That thing you speak of,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I took it for a man; often 'twould say

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: 'The fiend, the fiend:' he led me to that place.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Bear free and patient thoughts. But who comes here?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR, fantastically dressed with wild flowers

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The safer sense will ne'er accommodate

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: His master thus.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, they cannot touch me for coining; I am the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: king himself.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: O thou side-piercing sight!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nature's above art in that respect. There's your

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: press-money. That fellow handles his bow like a

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: crow-keeper: draw me a clothier's yard. Look,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: look, a mouse! Peace, peace; this piece of toasted

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: cheese will do 't. There's my gauntlet; I'll prove

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: it on a giant. Bring up the brown bills. O, well

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: flown, bird! i' the clout, i' the clout: hewgh!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Give the word.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Sweet marjoram.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pass.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I know that voice.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ha! Goneril, with a white beard! They flattered

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: me like a dog; and told me I had white hairs in my

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: beard ere the black ones were there. To say 'ay'

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: and 'no' to every thing that I said!--'Ay' and 'no'

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: too was no good divinity. When the rain came to

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: wet me once, and the wind to make me chatter; when

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: the thunder would not peace at my bidding; there I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: found 'em, there I smelt 'em out. Go to, they are

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: not men o' their words: they told me I was every

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: thing; 'tis a lie, I am not ague-proof.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The trick of that voice I do well remember:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is 't not the king?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ay, every inch a king:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When I do stare, see how the subject quakes.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I pardon that man's life. What was thy cause? Adultery?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou shalt not die: die for adultery! No:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The wren goes to 't, and the small gilded fly

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Does lecher in my sight.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let copulation thrive; for Gloucester's bastard son

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Was kinder to his father than my daughters

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Got 'tween the lawful sheets.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To 't, luxury, pell-mell! for I lack soldiers.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Behold yond simpering dame,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Whose face between her forks presages snow;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That minces virtue, and does shake the head

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To hear of pleasure's name;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The fitchew, nor the soiled horse, goes to 't

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With a more riotous appetite.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Down from the waist they are Centaurs,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Though women all above:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But to the girdle do the gods inherit,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beneath is all the fiends';

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: There's hell, there's darkness, there's the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: sulphurous pit,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Burning, scalding, stench, consumption; fie,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: fie, fie! pah, pah! Give me an ounce of civet,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: good apothecary, to sweeten my imagination:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: there's money for thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O, let me kiss that hand!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me wipe it first; it smells of mortality.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O ruin'd piece of nature! This great world

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shall so wear out to nought. Dost thou know me?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I remember thine eyes well enough. Dost thou squiny

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: at me? No, do thy worst, blind Cupid! I'll not

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: love. Read thou this challenge; mark but the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: penning of it.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Were all the letters suns, I could not see one.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I would not take this from report; it is,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And my heart breaks at it.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Read.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, with the case of eyes?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, ho, are you there with me? No eyes in your

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: head, nor no money in your purse? Your eyes are in

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: a heavy case, your purse in a light; yet you see how

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: this world goes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I see it feelingly.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What, art mad? A man may see how this world goes

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: with no eyes. Look with thine ears: see how yond

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: justice rails upon yond simple thief. Hark, in

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: thine ear: change places; and, handy-dandy, which

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: is the justice, which is the thief? Thou hast seen

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: a farmer's dog bark at a beggar?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And the creature run from the cur? There thou

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: mightst behold the great image of authority: a

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: dog's obeyed in office.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou rascal beadle, hold thy bloody hand!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why dost thou lash that whore? Strip thine own back;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou hotly lust'st to use her in that kind

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For which thou whipp'st her. The usurer hangs the cozener.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Through tatter'd clothes small vices do appear;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Robes and furr'd gowns hide all. Plate sin with gold,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And the strong lance of justice hurtless breaks:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Arm it in rags, a pigmy's straw does pierce it.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: None does offend, none, I say, none; I'll able 'em:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Take that of me, my friend, who have the power

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To seal the accuser's lips. Get thee glass eyes;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And like a scurvy politician, seem

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To see the things thou dost not. Now, now, now, now:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pull off my boots: harder, harder: so.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: O, matter and impertinency mix'd! Reason in madness!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If thou wilt weep my fortunes, take my eyes.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I know thee well enough; thy name is Gloucester:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou must be patient; we came crying hither:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou know'st, the first time that we smell the air,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: We wawl and cry. I will preach to thee: mark.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, alack the day!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When we are born, we cry that we are come

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To this great stage of fools: this a good block;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: It were a delicate stratagem, to shoe

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A troop of horse with felt: I'll put 't in proof;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And when I have stol'n upon these sons-in-law,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Then, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter a Gentleman, with Attendants

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: O, here he is: lay hand upon him. Sir,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Your most dear daughter--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No rescue? What, a prisoner? I am even

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The natural fool of fortune. Use me well;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You shall have ransom. Let me have surgeons;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I am cut to the brains.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: You shall have any thing.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No seconds? all myself?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, this would make a man a man of salt,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To use his eyes for garden water-pots,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ay, and laying autumn's dust.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Good sir,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will die bravely, like a bridegroom. What!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will be jovial: come, come; I am a king,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My masters, know you that.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: You are a royal one, and we obey you.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Then there's life in't. Nay, if you get it, you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: shall get it with running. Sa, sa, sa, sa.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit running; Attendants follow

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: A sight most pitiful in the meanest wretch,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Past speaking of in a king! Thou hast one daughter,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Who redeems nature from the general curse

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which twain have brought her to.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hail, gentle sir.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sir, speed you: what's your will?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Do you hear aught, sir, of a battle toward?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Most sure and vulgar: every one hears that,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which can distinguish sound.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But, by your favour,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How near's the other army?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Near and on speedy foot; the main descry

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Stands on the hourly thought.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I thank you, sir: that's all.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Though that the queen on special cause is here,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Her army is moved on.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I thank you, sir.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exit Gentleman

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You ever-gentle gods, take my breath from me:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let not my worser spirit tempt me again

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To die before you please!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Well pray you, father.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, good sir, what are you?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: A most poor man, made tame to fortune's blows;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who, by the art of known and feeling sorrows,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Am pregnant to good pity. Give me your hand,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I'll lead you to some biding.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hearty thanks:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The bounty and the benison of heaven

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To boot, and boot!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter OSWALD

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: A proclaim'd prize! Most happy!

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: That eyeless head of thine was first framed flesh

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: To raise my fortunes. Thou old unhappy traitor,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Briefly thyself remember: the sword is out

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: That must destroy thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now let thy friendly hand

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Put strength enough to't.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: EDGAR interposes

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Wherefore, bold peasant,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Darest thou support a publish'd traitor? Hence;

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Lest that the infection of his fortune take

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Like hold on thee. Let go his arm.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ch'ill not let go, zir, without vurther 'casion.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Let go, slave, or thou diest!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Good gentleman, go your gait, and let poor volk

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: pass. An chud ha' bin zwaggered out of my life,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'twould not ha' bin zo long as 'tis by a vortnight.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Nay, come not near th' old man; keep out, che vor

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: ye, or ise try whether your costard or my ballow be

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the harder: ch'ill be plain with you.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Out, dunghill!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ch'ill pick your teeth, zir: come; no matter vor

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: your foins.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: They fight, and EDGAR knocks him down

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Slave, thou hast slain me: villain, take my purse:

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: If ever thou wilt thrive, bury my body;

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: And give the letters which thou find'st about me

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: To Edmund earl of Gloucester; seek him out

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Upon the British party: O, untimely death!

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Dies

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I know thee well: a serviceable villain;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: As duteous to the vices of thy mistress

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: As badness would desire.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, is he dead?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Sit you down, father; rest you

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Let's see these pockets: the letters that he speaks of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: May be my friends. He's dead; I am only sorry

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He had no other death's-man. Let us see:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Leave, gentle wax; and, manners, blame us not:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To know our enemies' minds, we'ld rip their hearts;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Their papers, is more lawful.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Reads

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'Let our reciprocal vows be remembered. You have

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: many opportunities to cut him off: if your will

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: want not, time and place will be fruitfully offered.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: There is nothing done, if he return the conqueror:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: then am I the prisoner, and his bed my goal; from

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the loathed warmth whereof deliver me, and supply

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the place for your labour.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'Your--wife, so I would say--

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'Affectionate servant,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'GONERIL.'

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: O undistinguish'd space of woman's will!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: A plot upon her virtuous husband's life;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And the exchange my brother! Here, in the sands,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thee I'll rake up, the post unsanctified

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of murderous lechers: and in the mature time

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: With this ungracious paper strike the sight

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of the death practised duke: for him 'tis well

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That of thy death and business I can tell.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The king is mad: how stiff is my vile sense,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That I stand up, and have ingenious feeling

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Of my huge sorrows! Better I were distract:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So should my thoughts be sever'd from my griefs,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And woes by wrong imaginations lose

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The knowledge of themselves.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Give me your hand:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Drum afar off

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Far off, methinks, I hear the beaten drum:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Come, father, I'll bestow you with a friend.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exeunt
